results.title: Soldering
results.brief_description: Indicates that soldering plays a vital part in modern electronics and that it is esential to understand the art of soldering if becoming involved in this field. Provides the theory and demostrates the practical processes. No other credits available

results.title: Soldered spigot joint
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Tapering the end of the pipe with special tool, opening out with mandrel, use of coning tool for shaping, insertion of brass liner and application of solder. Recapitulation in diagram form.

results.title: Solder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Making a roof cesspool by another method, use of solder. Consideration of materials used. The solder itself, wiping cloths, plumbers’ black. Preparing the work for soldering; method of soldering; tools used.

results.title: Solas
results.creator_credit: Maestranza Films, Antonio P Perez and Benito Zambrano
results.brief_description: Thirtysomething Maria lives alone in a squalid quarter of a nameless Spanish city, having fled the rural home of her violent, alcoholic father and long-suffering mother. Embittered and depressed by her family life, her experiences with men, her menial job and her recent discovery that she is pregnant, she finds her only solace in alcohol. After her father is admitted to a nearby hospital she begrudgingly lets her mother stay with her while he recuperates. Although her daughter disdains her for silently tolerating years of abuse by her husband, Maria’s mother is nevertheless warm and loving, and does all she can to brighten her daughter’s life. She also befriends a neighbour in the same apartment block, a desperately lonely old man who quickly becomes attached to her and gives her the respect and affection she never experienced with her husband. Slowly and tentatively, mother and daughter begin to set aside their practiced antagonism and repair the lines of communication in their relationship. Buoyed by her newfound understanding of her mother and her own budding relationship with her elderly neighbour, Maria starts to gain new hope for her future. Highly successful in its home country, “Solas” is sensitively directed, never sliding into sentimentality, and is filled with standout performances from its small cast. Cast includes Ana Fernandez, Maria Galiana and Carlos Alvarez-Novoa. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Solaris [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mosfilm, Magna Corporation and Andrei Tarkovsky
results.brief_description: A psychologist is sent to a spaceship orbiting the planet Solaris to investigate the mysterious disappearances and deaths that have occurred on the ship. He discovers that madness has overtaken the occupants of the craft, who are haunted by the material presence of their guilty past. Soon, the psychologist too finds his past coming back to him in the shape of his dead wife. “Solaris” is an extraordinary science fiction movie that utilises the genre to investigate the increasing alienation and isolation of humanity, a condition accelerated by the rapid advances of technology. The film is ravishing to look at, from its opening shots of a meadow on earth, to the long gliding takes across the surface of the metallic craft. With “Solaris” Tarkovsky established a reputation as the finest Russian film-maker since the days of the silent masters. Along with Kubrick’s “2001”, Tarkovsky’s film is an intelligent and intensely communicated masterwork of science-fiction cinema. From the novel by Stanislaw Lem. Winner of the Special Jury Prize, 1972 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Solaris (2003)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lightstorm Entertainment, James Cameron, Rae Sanchini, Jon Landau and Steven Soderbergh
results.brief_description: Pyschologist Dr. Chris Kelvin (George Clooney) has been assigned to investigate the mysterious events occurring aboard a space station orbiting the planet Solaris. He discovers that the two surviving members on the station are struggling with their sanity and that the planet itself is a living organism with the power of entering human consciousness and recreating lost loves. Chris Kelvin is haunted by the visitation of his dead wife Khari (Natascha McElhone). This film is a remake of the more philosophical version by Andrei Tarkovsky released in 1972, and is more a personal investigation into the themes of memory and regret rather than spirituality and science. Beautiful production design lends itself to the dreamy and sensual pace. Based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem, this version is written and directed by Steven Soderbergh. Cast includes Jeremy Davies, Viola Davis and Ulrich Tukur.

results.title: Solaris
results.brief_description:
A distant planet fathoms the fears and memories buried in its observer’s minds and externalises these into living beings. As a result an astronaut relives a doomed relationship with his lost wife. In the novel by Polish writer Stanislaw Lem, Tarkovsky found the elements of obsession and repetition he needed for access to his own life - science fiction as grandiloquent autobiographical text. (Adapted from a note by Patrick Strick, NFT, London). Also available on VHS.

Credits: Director, Andrei Tarkovsky ; script, Friedrich Gorenstein, Andrei Tarkovsky ; photography, Vadim Yusov ; music, Eduard Artemyev ; production designer, Mikhail Romadin ; editor, Ludmila Feganova.
Cast: Natalya Bondarchuk, Donatas Banionis, Yuri Yarvet, Nikolai Grinko, Anatoly Solonitsyn.
Note: Based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem.

results.title: Solar water heating
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, S.T. Evans, Roger Morse and Ted Davey
results.brief_description: Collecting solar energy for use in water heaters. A CSIRO scientist explains how the absorbers work and, with the aid of diagrams, how they operate on the principle of thermo-cyclic-flow. Their installation and economy are also demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: CSIRO, S.T. Evans, Roger Morse and Ted Davey

results.title: Solar promise
results.creator_credit: Bullfrog Films, Henry Mayer and Tom Putnam
results.brief_description: Examines the use of solare energy for home heating. Active and passive systems are illustrated and the principles of each are outlined. A variety of homes are shown and the costs, advantages and potential for a wide range of climate conditions are fully covered. Reference is made to the indians of southwest America who understood and used passive solar heating.
